required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Humanized CD19 Chimeric Antigen Receptor (CAR)-Modified T Cell Therapy in Treating Patients With B-cell Malignancies
clinical_study.official_title: Treatment of Relapsed or Refractory B-cell Malignancies by Humanized CD19 Chimeric Antigen Receptor (CAR)-Modified T Cells

lead_sponsor.agency: Wuhan Sian Medical Technology Co., Ltd

clinical_study.source: Wuhan Sian Medical Technology Co., Ltd

brief_summary.textblock: This is a single arm, open-label study to evaluate the safety and efficacy of humanized anti-CD19 CAR-T cells in patients with relapsed or refractory B cell Malignancies.

detailed_description.textblock: Chimeric antigen receptor (CAR)-modified T cells (CAR-T cells) have the capabilities to recognize tumor associated antigen and kill tumor cells specifically. CAR-T therapy showed great effect on patients with relapsed or refractory B cell malignancies. To improve the efficacy and safety, the researchers designed a second-generation humanized CAR, consisting of humanized CD19 single chain variable fragment (scFv) and CD137 costimulatory domain. This study aims to evaluate the safety and effectiveness of humanized anti-CD19 CAR-T cells in patients with relapsed or refractory B cell Malignancies.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with adverse events
primary_outcome.description: Therapy-related adverse events were recorded and assessed according to the National Cancer Institute's Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events (CTCAE, Version 4.0)

secondary_outcome.description: Response of B-ALL to CAR-T therapy was assessed on day 30 (Â±2), against the National Comprehensive Cancer Network (NCCN, Version 1.2015).
OS was calculated from the first CAR-T cell infusion to death or last follow-up (censored).
EFS was calculated from the first CAR-T cell infusion to death, progression of the disease, relapse or gene recurrence, whichever came first, or last visit (censored).
RFS was calculated from the first CAR-T cell infusion to relapse or last visit (censored).

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of anti-CD19 CAR-T cells in bone marrow cells and peripheral blood cells
secondary_outcome.description: In vivo (bone marrow and peripheral blood) rate of CAR-T cells were determined by means of flow cytometry.

secondary_outcome.measure: Quantity of anti-CD19 CAR-T cells in bone marrow cells and peripheral blood cells
secondary_outcome.description: In vivo (bone marrow and peripheral blood) quantity of CAR-T cells were determined by means of flow cytometry.

secondary_outcome.measure: Quantity of anti-CD19 CAR copies in bone marrow cells and peripheral blood cells
secondary_outcome.description: In vivo (bone marrow and peripheral blood) quantity of anti-CD19 CAR copies were determined by means of qPCR.

arm_group.description: Patients receive humanized CD19 CAR-T cells transduced with a lentiviral vector on days 0/1/2 in the absence of disease progression or unacceptable toxicity.

intervention.description: Patients receive humanized CD19 CAR-T cells transduced with a lentiviral vector on days 0/1/2 in the absence of disease progression or unacceptable toxicity.

facility.name: Union Hospital, Tongji Medical College, Huazhong University of Science and Technology
